intro: Pungamia, commonly known as the white kowhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Pungamia thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. It is often found in forest margins and open areas, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
